definition[0]: to buy something immediately, especially because it is very cheap
definition[1]: to eagerly take an opportunity to have someone as part of your company, team etc
example[1]: Owen was snapped up by Liverpool before he’d even left school.
example[2]: If you see a computer for under £400, you should snap it up.
definition[2]: to eagerly take an opportunity to employ someone or have them as part of your team
example[3]: He so impressed the interviewing panel that they snapped him up immediately.
